content.description: Fun sport climb, crux near the middle.
content.location: Fourth route from right on Wall of Waltzing Witches (on opposite side of ridge from main walls).  Just right of a tree.

content.description: Worth doing but not the best route in the area.  Mostly easy climbing with a few interesting moves at the start and in the middle.
content.location: Rightmost climb on Wall of Waltzing Witches (on the opposite side of the ridge from the main walls).

content.description: Harder start, reasonably sustained, one of the taller climbs on this wall.
content.location: Fifth route from right end of Wall of Waltzing Witches, between the two juniper trees.

content.description: Tricky start, then easier climbing, then another crux about 2/3 up.

Hard start through second bolt then pretty easy the rest of the way.  Definitely the easiest of the three 5.9+ climbs on this wall.  A tall person can pretty easily clip the first bolt from the ground.
content.location: Third route from left end of Wall of Waltzing Witches, the middle one of three close climbs.

content.description: The Tucson Sport Climbing guidebook describes this as one hard move to easier climbing.  I would describe it as four bolts worth of hard moves to easier climbing.  Very fun thin moves.  The start is the hardest move, but it stays 5.10ish for a while.
content.location: Second climb from right on the Wall of Waltzing Witches.

climbs.name: I'd Turn Back If I Were You

content.description: No real crux, fairly sustained climbing on mostly good holds, bulge just below anchors.  Tallest climb on this wall.
content.location: Sixth route from right end of Wall of Waltzing Witches, left of the two juniper trees in the middle of the wall.

content.description: Easier start than People Do... but quite a bit harder and more sustained overall. Crux is near the middle, fun moves.
content.location: Fourth route from left end of Wall of Waltzing Witches, rightmost of three close climbs.

content.description: One guidebook rates this 5.9+ but it is considerably harder than the other climbs of that grade on this wall.  I found it harder and more sustained than We Wish to Welcome You (.10b) around the other side.  Hard start, tricky second clip, crux is slightly overhanging section up high.
content.location: Third climb from the right end of Wall of Waltzing Witches.

content.description: There are supposed to be 10 routes at Waltzing Witches but I count 9 posted (prior to this post).  Apologies if I missed this one, but it doesn't seem to be listed.  This is the second route from the left, the first of 3 close climbs.  I found it to be harder than People Do Go Both Ways (middle route of the 3 close climbs), but not by much.
content.location: Second from the left, the first of 3 close climbs.

content.description: The Wall of the Waltzing Witches faces in a sort of southerly direction, on the other side of the ridge south of Munchkin Wall. Where you head right down off the ridge right at the end of the approach to get to Munchkin Wall, you turn left and head up and over to get to this wall. The routes are easier by and large, and more slab style than Munchkin. The sun hits this wall from early day to afternoon and can be hot in the summer, so plan accordingly.
